result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J. Mancl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any further violent and/or confrontational contact with K.D.F.
Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. DNA Sample and Surcharge.

Bond previously posted in the amount of $350 has been applied. Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J. Mancl

records.addlTxt: Cases 21CM306 & 22CM2 called @ 9:39 AM Defendant Andrew J. Mancl in court.  Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court for Andrew J. Mancl.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 21CM306 - Count 1 - Guilty, 22CM2 - Count 1 - Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 21CM306 - Counts 2 & 3 - DRI, 22CM2 - Count 2 - DRI. Statement by the victim. Statement by Atty Gardner. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W - 2 years probation. Conditions: As to 21CM306 only: 30 days WC Jail, Huber, No Good Time. Sentence to commence no later than August 19, 2022 @ 7:00 PM unless supervising agent orders an earlier start date. As to both 21CM306 & 22CM2: AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any further violent and/or confrontational contact with K.D.F. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. DNA Sample and Surcharge. Bond previously posted to be applied. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
NOT PUT OF RECORD Attorney Robert A. Gardner appeared by phone for Andrew J. Mancl.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.
Status conference on April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Andrew J. Mancl appeared in court.  Attorney Dennis J. Ryan appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court makes statement regarding notice of retainer filed and sets additional status.
Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on March 8, 2022 at 09:40 am.

10:13 AM Defendant Andrew J. Mancl appeared in court, Attorney Wes Kottke appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant regarding counsel. Defendant states he has counsel but his attorney has court in another jurisdiction-Attorney Garnder has been retained. Court questions defendant regarding retainer fee being paid-Defendant states he will pay the retainer this week.
Status conference on February 8, 2022 at 10:05 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

21CM 306 & 22CM2 Cases called @ 02:17 PM Defendant Andrew J. Mancl in court.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be privately retaining counsel.  NGP entered. Court orders 21CM306 - $850 Cash Bond, 22CM2 - $350 Cash Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 10:05 am.
